oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Country Music History program - Volume 1 - Recording 1 - Side 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Various voice overs by an unidentified male narrator. Subject matter pertains to the history of country music, and recording is likely linked to a country music history radio program, exhibit, or documentary. Tape is labeled as: volume one, recording one, side one.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) An unidentified speaker discusses the success of Jimmie Rodgers -- (00:30) T for Texas (Jimmie Rodgers) -- (03:40) An unidentified speaker introduces Ernest Tubb to reflect on Rodgers -- (04:04) Last Thoughts (My Blue Bonnet Dream) (Jimmie Rodgers) -- (06:53) An unidentified speaker reflects on Gene Autry's start in country music during 1931 -- (07:08) Autry reflects on his first musical experience -- (07:27) Jimmie the Kid (Gene Autry) -- (10:09) An unidentified speaker discusses Ralph Peer discovering Rodgers and the Carter Family -- (10:40) Maybelle Carter reflects on how she was asked to make her first record -- (11:15) Worried Man Blues (Carter Family) -- (13:43) An unidentified speaker reflects on the market crash of the 1930's while introducing Pee Wee King -- (14:26) Pee Wee King reflects on the difficulty of earning money in the 1930's -- (14:36) Slow Poke (Pee Wee King) -- (17:26) An unidentified speaker introduces the Sons of the Pioneers -- (18:03) Cool Water (Pioneers) -- (19:56) An unidentified speaker reflects on the disasters of 1936 and Homer and Jethro -- (20:13) Homer and Jethro joke to each other -- (20:27) How Much is That Hound Dog in the Window (Homer and Jethro) -- (23:02) The History of Country Music (Unconfirmed) ([Unidentified])
